mnemonic: DE sounds like 'duh' - where are you FROM? DUH!
grammar_notes: Contracts with articles: de+o=do de+a=da de+os=dos de+as=das.
cultural_note: 'Sou de...' (I'm from...) is usually the first thing Portuguese ask foreigners!
tip: Most common preposition - contracts with articles

mnemonic: DO = DE + O combined - the O is DOing its job!
grammar_notes: Contraction of de + o. Required - cannot say 'de o'.
cultural_note: 'Do Porto' means both 'from Porto' and 'of Porto wine'!

mnemonic: DA = DE + A - DA feminine contraction!
grammar_notes: Contraction of de + a. Required - cannot say 'de a'.
cultural_note: 'Da casa' appears in famous fado lyrics - the home is sacred!

mnemonic: EM sounds like 'aim' - AIM to be IN the right place!
cultural_note: 'Em Portugal' vs 'em Lisboa' - country vs city same preposition!

mnemonic: NO = EM + O - NOW you're IN the place!
grammar_notes: Contraction of em + o. Required with masculine definite article.
cultural_note: 'No norte' (in the north) - where the famous vinho verde comes from!

mnemonic: NA = EM + A - NAH I'm IN here!
grammar_notes: Contraction of em + a. Required with feminine definite article.
cultural_note: 'Na praia' (at the beach) - Portugal has amazing beaches!

mnemonic: PARA sounds like PARROT - I'm going TO where the PARROT is!
grammar_notes: Indicates direction/destination or purpose. Different from 'a'.
cultural_note: 'Para' suggests permanence 'a' suggests temporary - subtle but important!

mnemonic: POR sounds like POOR - the POOR go THROUGH hardship!
cultural_note: 'Obrigado por tudo' is a warm Portuguese way to express gratitude.

mnemonic: COM sounds like COMB - I COMB my hair WITH a comb!
grammar_notes: Shows accompaniment or means. 'Comigo' = with me 'contigo' = with you.

mnemonic: SEM sounds like 'same' - the SAME but WITHOUT something!
grammar_notes: Opposite of 'com'. Used for absence of something.
cultural_note: 'Sem problema' is the Brazilian way 'sem problema' works in Portugal too!

mnemonic: A is just 'ah' - AH I'm going TO there!
grammar_notes: Direction or specific time. Contracts: a+o=ao a+a=à.
cultural_note: 'A que horas?' (at what time?) - useful for scheduling in Portugal.

mnemonic: AO = A + O - sounds like 'ow' when you bump INTO something!
grammar_notes: Contraction of a + o. Used with masculine nouns.
cultural_note: 'Ao lado de' (next to) is essential for giving directions!

mnemonic: À = A + A - the accent shows TWO A's merged!
grammar_notes: Contraction of a + a. Grave accent (`) marks the contraction.
cultural_note: 'À noite' (at night) - when Portuguese nightlife really starts!
tip: Contraction of a + a - note accent
